body_html:
/home/g008kaaraan/anaconda2/bin is in your PATH. Do you have Anaconda? If you have Anaconda but your Python is still /usr/bin then you did not install Anaconda correctly. If you don't have Anaconda, I recommend that you do install it. It is actually much easier and safer to work with then the default Ubuntu Python.

Please follow the advice in https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-is-caffe2-not-working-as-expected-in-anaconda and in https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 . If you need to install from source for Detectron then you'll need to follow https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path

body:
/home/g008kaaraan/anaconda2/bin is in your PATH. Do you have Anaconda? If you have Anaconda but your Python is still /usr/bin then you did not install Anaconda correctly. If you don't have Anaconda, I recommend that you do install it. It is actually much easier and safer to work with then the default Ubuntu Python.

Please follow the advice in https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-is-caffe2-not-working-as-expected-in-anaconda and in https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-do-i-get-import-errors-in-python-when-i-try-to-use-caffe2 . If you need to install from source for Detectron then you'll need to follow https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path
